name: Accurate
effect: Accurate Attacks innately have Advantage.

name: Arc
effect: Pick a space within Range, then choose 3 adjacent spaces. Target all spaces within.

name: Arcing
effect: Arcing Attacks treat _Covered_ as _Heavily Obstructed_ instead and _Heavily Obstructed_ as _Lightly Obstructed_, so long as a path exists over Obstacles that can reach the Target.

name: Artillery
effect: Attacks with the Artillery Keyword have Disadvantage on all attacks against creature X spaces or less away, where X is their Artillery value.

name: Attach
effect: Maneuvers are Attached to Techniques. While Attached, any Keywords that the Maneuver has are granted to the Technique, and additional Effects are resolved,  as outlined on the Maneuver. To Attach an Maneuver to a Technique, that Technique must fulfill all the Maneuver's Requirements.

name: Avoidable
effect: The Cost of Evade Reactions is reduced by 1 against this Action.

name: Blast
effect: Pick a space within Range. That space, and all spaces within X, where X is the Blast's value, are targeted.

name: Block
effect: Block Maneuvers are based on absorbing a blow to mitigate the overall damage. Many Actions and abilities reference Block Maneuvers.

name: Body
effect: Weapons with the Body Keyword can be used regardless of what a character has Wielded.

name: Burst
effect: Pick a space within Range. All spaces within X, where X is the Burst's value, spaces of the space are targeted. The targeted space is not effected.

name: Blitz
effect: Movement with the Blitz keyword can move through squares occupied by hostile creatures, but may not end their movement their.

name: Climable
effect: A side of a space may be climable if it has obvious handholds or avenues to climb that make traversal easier. Climbing in a climable space only costs 1 + the vertical distance covered.

name: Colossal
effect: Gain Hobbled 1, Exposed 1 (2 Grit) if you're Wielding it at Refresh or when you begin Wielding this weapon after combat has begun. You must pay 1 Grit when you Attack with it, or else have Disadvantage.

name: Combo
effect: When an Attack is listed as a Combo, treat it and all other Combo Attacks made this Turn as a single Attack for the purpose of all Gambits, except ones with the Edge keyword.

name: Cone
effect: Pick a space within Range. Draw a triangle so that each side is X long, where X is the Cone value.

name: Condense
effect: Take the creature's total Value of a Token and divide it into the minimum number of Tokens. For example, a creature with Impaired 1x3 would have Impaired 3 after this Technique.

name: Counter
effect: A Maneuver typically used in response to an Attack that allows a character to strike back against a foe. Each Turn, a character may use either a Defend Maneuver or a Counter Maneuver.

name: Defend
effect: A Maneuver typically used in response to an Attack that allows a character to mitigate harm in some way. Each Turn, a character may use either a Defend Maneuver or a Counter Maneuver.

name: Derived
effect: This Terrain's Source is the same as whatever the Terrain beneath it is; i.e., if it is created on Earthen Terrain, it is in turn Earthen.

name: Earth
effect: Techniques with this keyword rely on an Earth spirit as well as a strong connection with the ground. If a character is not on or immediately above (such as standing on the wooden floor of a house) Earthen Terrain (such as while Jumping), increase the cost of this Technique by 1. If the character is Flying, increase it by 2. If there is no Earthen Terrain or Obstacles with 5 spaces (such as when on the deck of a ship) this Technique may not be used.

name: Earthen
effect: Earthen Terrain or Obstacles are prominent above-ground features created primarily from earth or stone. Boulders and Earth Pillars are obvious examples, but any stone structure can qualify as Earthen.

name: Efficient
effect: Reactions with the Efficient Keyword do not use your Reaction for the Turn.

name: Electric
effect: Actions with the Electric Keyword excel at hitting conductive targets. Electric Attacks have Advantage against any Creature that has a Metal Source or is Soaked. In addition, Electric Techniques that target a creature in a Water Source may ignore their typical area. If the Technique was previously Single Target, halve the damage but it instead becomes a Blast 1 if Range or Burst 1 if melee. If the Technique had an Area, increase the size of the Area by 1. Regardless, the Technique has Advantage.

name: Enchant
effect: Enchant effects are an effect that persists for multiple Turns or Rounds. A creature may only have one Enchant ability in effect at a time.

name: Environmental
effect: This Maneuver must be Attached to the Use Environment Technique. Only a single Maneuver with this Tag may be Attached at a time.

name: Evade
effect: Evade Maneuvers typically involve avoiding a blow or quickly moving to avoid further damage. Many Actions and abilities reference Evade Maneuvers.

name: Feint
effect: A special type of Gambit that typically means that, if the opponent does not pay some resources, you'll receive some benefit on the next Attack against them.

name: Fleeting
effect: Tokens with the Fleeting Keyword are lost at the end of the current Turn.

name: Flourish
effect: A Flourish is a Maneuver that is typically used after a character hits with an Attack. A character may use one _Flourish_ per _Turn_.

name: Fluid
effect: Reduce the Cost to Improvise this Action or an Action using this Weapon by its Fluid Value. This only reduces the Cost to Improvise, not the overall Cost of the Action or Maneuver.

name: Fist
effect: Weapons with the Fist Keyword require an Open Hand to use.

name: Gambit
effect: Gambits are various small ways characters can attempt to gain an advantage in combat. A character may use any number of Gambits per Turn, but only one Edge may be applied to a single Attack.

name: Glancing
effect: This Effect deals half Damage and has its cost to Negate halved or reduced by 1, whichever results in a lower cost. If an Attack already has Glancing and gains it from another source the attack instead fails.

name: Groundsource
effect: Groundsource Attacks are always treated as Melee, Area Effects are not stopped by Obstacles like normal, and Groundsource attacks ignore Covered. In exchange, both the user and Target of Groundsource Techniques must be used on Earthen Terrain. Flying creatures are immune to all Groundsource effects.

name: Heavy
effect: Heavy Techniques and Weapons are powerful and have access to many Maneuvers that allow delaying Speed to increase efficacy.

name: Kick
effect: Weapons with the Kick Keyword can be used regardless of what a character has Wielded but have Disadvantage if a character is Stuck and take a Penalty to Attack Rolls equal to the character's topmost Hobbled Token.

name: Light
effect: Light Techniques and Weapons are swift and specialize in acting quicker than other foes.

name: Line
effect: Pick a space within Range. Draw a straight line from that space in any direction. Target the first X spaces in that line, where X is the Line value.

name: Leaping
effect: Any Leaping Movement ignores Terrain that does not effect Flying characters. Characters may also go up Elevation while Leaping so long as they have sufficient Leaping Movement.

name: Melee
effect: This may only be used to Attack Targets within your Reach.

name: Obstacle
effect: Noteworthy terrain on the battlefield that can typically either be used as Cover or be interacted with in some way.

name: One-Handed
effect: This Equipment only requires one hand to Wield.

name: Ordnance
effect: Any Attack with this Weapon must be made before any Movement is made as a part of this Action.

name: Parry
effect: Parry Maneuvers are based on intercepting an attack with an attack of your own. Many Techniques and abilities reference Parry Maneuvers.

name: Pierce
effect: This Attack ignores an amount of the Target's Guard equal to its Pierce value.

name: Punish
effect: A Maneuver used in response to an opposing character fulfilling some trigger. A character may use a single Punish Maneuver each Turn.

name: Quick
effect: This Maneuver may not be used with Heavy Techniques.

name: Parrying
effect: A Parrying Attack does no Damage and inflicts no Status unless otherwise specified.

name: Priority
effect: A Priority Action is always resolved at the start of its Phase. It ignores normal turn order and does not count for the alternating turns within a Round.

name: Reach
effect: Reach is how far away a Melee Attack can be used to attack a creature. Most Melee Attacks have Reach 1 but some, such as Pole Weapons, have a greater Reach.

name: Safe
effect: All Punishes triggered by Movement this Turn cost an additional X, where X is this Technique's Safe value.

name: Scout
effect: When you Scout a creature you learn their current exact Health and how much Focus, Grit, Reflex, or Momentum (your choice) the creature has.

name: Siege
effect: Attacks with Siege deal +2 Damage to Obstacles and have Advantage on Attacks against them.

name: Stratagem
effect: Stratagems are ways to enhance a Technique that must be used when the Technique is played, whether that be at Refresh, while Improvising, or as a part of another Maneuver. Stratagems often change the Speed or AP cost of a Technique.

name: Stunt
effect: Stunts are quick, simple Maneuvers such as jumping or picking up an item that characters may use on their Turn. Characters may use as many Stunts as they can pay for, but may not repeat a Stunt unless it has the Repeatable keyword.

name: Sundering
effect: Attacks with this tag don't have Disadvantage when attacking _Wielded_ Equipment.

name: Strong
effect: This Maneuver may not be used with Light Techniques.

name: Sure Hit
effect: The Cost of Evade Reactions is increased by its Sure Hit value against this Technique.

name: Stall
effect: A Stall Action is always resolved at the end of its Phase. It ignores normal turn order and does not count for the alternating turns within a Round.

name: Edge
effect: A special type of Gambit that may only be applied to a single Attack once.

name: Repeatable
effect: This Stunt may be used multiple times in a Turn, paying the cost each time.

name: Reveal
effect: When a creature is inflicted with Reveal their next Technique and what Phase it is occurring in is revealed. If a creature has no more Techniques this round, they instead have Insight 1 inflicted.

name: Reaction
effect: A Maneuver that may be freely used when its Trigger occurs. Characters may use as many Reactions as they wish on a given Turn, but may not repeat a Reaction unless otherwise specified.

name: Rigid
effect: This Technique may not be Improvised.

name: Rush
effect: When taking your Movement with a Technique that has the Rush Keyword you must move in a straight line.

name: Stairs
effect: A side of a space may be designated as stairs if it has an obvious path up, such as literal stairs. It costs no additional movement to move up 1 Elevation when moving through a stairs segment of a space.

name: Teleport
effect: Teleport Movement ignores Terrain, Obstacles, and cannot provoke Reactions.

name: Thrown
effect: Thrown weapons are capable of being used in both melee and ranged combat. When Thrown, Grazes deal no damage and cause no effects, and are treated as a Miss. After being thrown, a Thrown weapon may not be used again until retrieved. Unlike most Weapons, you may use a Thrown Weapon to attack if it is Equipped, but must have a Free Hand and not be Disarmed to do so. After throwing a Wielded Thrown Weapon, you may immediately Wield a different Thrown Weapon with the same number of required Hands.

name: Two-Handed
effect: This Equipment requires both hands to Wield.

name: Unblockable
effect: The Cost of Block and Parry Maneuvers is increased by its Unblockable value against this Technique.

name: Upkeep
effect: Enchant effects with Upkeep must pay the listed cost at Refresh or else end the Enchant.

name: Versatile
effect: Versatile Techniques and Weapons are built for balanced combat, and can be used for most Maneuvers, albeit not as well as the more-specialized Light or Heavy Techniques.

name: Incoming
effect: An Incoming Attack is created by launching a projectile into the air, preparing an explosion, or any other effect that creates a Hazard. When drawing the Attack Line, draw it from the space where you created the Hazard, not the space you are in when you make the Attack.

name: Watery
effect: Watery Terrain or Obstacles are coated in enough water to be relevant to a Waterbound. Deep water is an obvious example, but even a large puddle can be relevant.

name: Warding
effect: The Cost of Counters is increased by its Warding value against this Technique.

name: Weapon Attack
effect: When a Technique/Maneuver allows you to make a Weapon Attack, reference the 'Weapon' field of said Technique/Maneuver. Make an Attack using a Wielded Weapon that matches the criteria listed and modifying it as listed by the Technique.

name: Weak
effect: The Cost of Block Reactions is reduced by 1 against this Technique.

name: Wide Line
effect: Pick a space within Range. Draw a straight line from that space in any direction. Target the first X spaces in that line, where X is the first numerical value. Additionally, make an additional X lines, where X is the second numerical value. These lines must be parallel and adjacent to another line created by this effect.
